Actors_and_Geometry.Description: Defines Actors and their use in level design, including common Actor types.

Actor_Definition.Description: An Actor is an object in a Level (camera, Mesh, player start). Supports 3D transformations. Created and destroyed via gameplay code.

Level_Creation.Description: Place, move, and scale Actors to create environments. Add scripts for behavior. Covers basic Actor techniques.

Common_Actor_Types.Description: Not comprehensive. Some plugins/templates add Actors. Availability varies.

Working_with_Actors.Placing_Actors: Place props, lights, cameras in Level.
Working_with_Actors.Selecting_Actors: Methods for selecting Actors in Level Editor.
Working_with_Actors.Transforming_Actors: Modify location, rotation, scale of Actors.
Working_with_Actors.Actor_Snapping: Overview of Actor snapping in Unreal Engine.
Working_with_Actors.Actor_Mobility: Controls if Actor can move/change during gameplay.
Working_with_Actors.Grouping_Actors: Create and work with Actor groups.
Working_with_Actors.Merging_Actors: Merge multiple Static Mesh Actors into one.

Resources: Developer Forums for peer questions and help.

Placing_Actors.Description: How to place Actors like props, lights, cameras into your Level.

Actor_Definition.Description: Actors are objects placed in a Level (Static Meshes, sounds, cameras, etc.). Creating an instance of an Actor adds it to the World Outliner.

Required_Setup.Description: Create a new project in Unreal Editor. Examples use the Third Person Template.

Using_Place_Actors_Panel.Description: Place Actors from the Place Actors panel. Open via Window > Place Actor. Consists of Search, Filters, Asset View.
Using_Place_Actors_Panel.Asset_View: Shows Assets matching search or filters.

Placing_Actors_Context_Menu.Description: Place Actors using the context menu by right-clicking in the Level Viewport.

Replacing_Actors.Description: Replace Actors using the context menu.

Placing_Actors_Drag_Drop.Description: Add Actors via drag and drop from Content Browser.

Steps_Drag_Drop: Drag and drop Asset into Level Viewport.

Steps_Class_Viewer: Open Class Viewer via Tools > Class Viewer.
Select Asset and drag into Level Viewport.

Selecting_Actors.Description: Methods for selecting Actors in the Level Editor viewport.
Selecting_Actors.Importance: Enhances productivity and speeds up the design process.

Simple_Selection.Description: Left-click to select, Ctrl+click to add/remove Actors.
Simple_Selection.Usage: Good for small numbers of Actors or isolated Actors.
Simple_Selection.Highlight: Selected Actors highlighted in yellow, Transform widget visible.

Methods.Group_Transformation: Transform multiple selected Actors as a group and modify their properties in the Details panel.
Methods.Grouping_Actors: Add multiple selected Actors to a group for easier re-selection or property changes.

World_Outliner.Description: Hierarchical tree view of all Actors in the level. Located at the right-hand side of the Unreal Editor window.
Selection_Methods: Click an Actor, then Shift+click another Actor to select all between them.
Ctrl+click multiple Actors to select all, even if not in sequence.
World_Outliner.Note: Selecting in World Outliner selects in Viewport and vice versa.

Marquee_Selection.Description: Select/deselect group of Actors by click-and-dragging the mouse.

Select_Menu.Description: Advanced selection techniques from Unreal Editor's menu bar.

Options.Description: Selects all Actors in the Level.
Centers selected Actor in Level Viewport.
Selects immediate children of selected Actor.
Selects all children of selected Actor.
Selects all Light Actors affecting selected Actor.
Selects all Actors with same Static Mesh and class.
Selects all Actors with same Static Mesh.
Selects all Actors with same Material.

Transforming_Actors.Description: Modify location, rotation, and scale of Actors in a Level.
Transforming_Actors.Overview: Transforming involves moving, rotating, or scaling Actors. Methods: Manual and Interactive.

Manual_Transformation.Description: Use the Transform section in the Details panel to edit Location, Rotation, Scale.
Manual_Transformation.Fields: X, Y, Z axes for numeric entry or mouse drag.
Manual_Transformation.Multiple_Actors: Shows Multiple Values for varied properties. Reset with Reset to Default button.
Manual_Transformation.Lock_Scale: Lock Scale button for uniform scaling.
Manual_Transformation.Coordinate_Space: Default to relative; toggle to world with dropdown.

Interactive_Transformation.Description: Use gizmos in the Level Viewport for visual transformation.
Interactive_Transformation.Gizmo_Forms: Toggle between types with Space Bar.

Translation_Gizmo.Description: Color-coded arrows for axis movement. Use grid snapping for precision.

Rotation_Gizmo.Highlight: Hover turns arc yellow, shows rotation amount.

Scale_Gizmo.Description: Handles with cubes for axis scaling. Scale uniformly by dragging center cube.

Transformation_Modes.Description: World vs. Local space. Toggle with Globe/Cube icon.

Pivot_Point.Description: Adjust pivot temporarily by middle-clicking gizmo center.
Pivot_Point.Permanent_Adjust: Right-click > Pivot > Set as Pivot Offset.

Keyboard_Shortcuts.Action: Select Actors with same Static Mesh

Actor_Snapping.Description: Overview of Actor snapping in Unreal Engine, aligning Actors with grids or objects.

Surface_Snapping.Description: Aligns Actors to surfaces. Enable via Surface Snapping button in Level Viewport toolbar.

Options.Rotate_to_Surface_Normal: Actors rotate to match surface alignment.

Surface_Snapping.Shortcut: Press End key to snap Actor to nearest surface.

Grid_Snapping.Description: Moves, rotates, or scales Actors in specific increments.

Grids.Scale_Grid: Snaps to additive increments, configurable to percentages.

Grid_Snapping.Activation: Click grid icon in Level Viewport toolbar, change increments via dropdown.

Snapping_Preferences.Description: Configure snapping settings in Editor Preferences > Viewports > Snap.

Custom_Grids.Decimal_Grid_Intervals: Decimal interval between grid lines in orthographic viewports.

Custom_Grids.Pow_2_Grid_Intervals: Power-of-2 interval between grid lines in orthographic viewports.

Custom_Grids.Divisions_Of_360_Rot_Grid_Sizes: Customize divisions of 360 rotation grid intervals.

Vertex_Snapping.Description: Snap objects by their polygonal vertices.
Vertex_Snapping.Usage: Hold V key while using translation gizmo. Useful with pivot adjustment for precise placement.

Actor_Mobility.Description: Controls whether an Actor can move or change during gameplay. Applies to Static Mesh and Light Actors.
Actor_Mobility.Location: Actor's Details panel under Transform coordinates.

Static_Actors.Description: Do not move or update during gameplay.

Static_Mesh_Actors.Shadows: Contribute to pre-calculated lightmaps using Lightmass.
Static_Mesh_Actors.Ideal_Use: Structural or decorative meshes that do not relocate.

Light_Actors.Shadows: Contribute to pre-calculated lightmaps using Lightmass.
Light_Actors.Lighting: Illuminate Static and Stationary Actors; use indirect lighting for Movable Actors.

Stationary_Actors.Description: Can change but not move during gameplay.

Static_Mesh_Actors.Lighting: Lit like Movable Actors with Static/Stationary Lights; use Cached Shadow Map for Movable Lights.

Light_Actors.Description: Can change color or intensity during gameplay.
Light_Actors.Shadows: Contribute to pre-calculated lightmaps and cast dynamic shadows for moving objects.

Stationary_Actors.Performance: Too many Stationary Lights affecting the same Actor can impact performance.

Movable_Actors.Description: Can be added, removed, or changed during gameplay.

Static_Mesh_Actors.Shadows: Cast fully dynamic shadows, do not contribute to precomputed lighting.

Light_Interaction.Stationary_Light: Combination of dynamic shadowing and precomputed lighting (Volumetric Lightmaps).

Light_Interaction.Static_Light: Lit by precomputed lighting, no dynamic shadows.

Light_Actors.Description: Cast dynamic shadows, can move and change color/intensity at runtime.
Light_Actors.Performance: Dynamic shadows are performance intensive, but non-shadow-casting lights add no rendering cost.

Grouping_Actors.Description: Create and manage groups of Actors in Unreal Engine.
Benefits: Transform grouped Actors as a single unit.
Temporarily unlock to transform individual Actors.
Add and remove Actors from a group.
Grouping_Actors.Group_Rules: An Actor can only belong to one group at a time.

Allow_Group_Selection.Description: Enable from Settings menu or toggle with Ctrl + Shift + G.

Methods: Select Actors, right-click, and choose Group.
Grouping_Methods.Indication: Grouped Actors delineated with green brackets.

Grouping_Actors.Group_Limits: Cannot group Actors from different Levels; moving an Actor to another Level removes it from the group.

Group_Actor.Description: Created in World Outliner when Actors are grouped.
Group_Actor.Selection: Select the Group Actor or any member to select all in the group.

Working_with_Groups.Context_Menu: Group section in context menu for Actor or group selection.

Regrouping.Description: Regroups selected Actors into a new group.
Behaviors: No Actor groups: Creates new group with selected Actors.
At least one Actor group: Regroups selected Actors.

Ungrouping.Description: Removes Actors from groups and deletes groups.

Lock_and_Unlock_Group.Description: Locks or unlocks group for transformations.
Lock_and_Unlock_Group.Indication: Green brackets for locked, red for unlocked.
Locked_State: Selecting any Actor selects entire group.

Add_to_Group.Description: Adds ungrouped Actors to selected group.
Add_to_Group.Availability: Select one group and other ungrouped Actors.

Remove_from_Group.Description: Removes selected Actors from unlocked group.
Remove_from_Group.Behavior: Nested group removed remains a group.

Add_Remove_Actors.Empty_Group: Automatically deleted if no Actors remain.

Pivot_Point.Description: Set to group's center point by default.
Pivot_Point.Group_Transform: Locked group transforms around group pivot.
Pivot_Point.Individual_Transform: Unlock group to transform individual Actors.
Setting_Pivot: Select group, hold Alt, middle-click to set pivot.
Middle-click and drag sphere at gizmo center to move pivot.

Merging_Actors.Description: Combine Static Mesh Actors into a single Actor to reduce draw calls and optimize performance.
Workflow: Select Static Mesh Actors in Level Viewport or World Outliner.
Go to Actor > Merge Actors from the top menu.
Choose merge type: Merge, Simplify, Batch, or Approximate.
Name the new Actor, select folder, and click Save.

Merge_Types.Description: Creates one mesh section per Material. Option to merge all Materials into one.
Merges into a single Proxy Mesh using lowest-detail LOD. Reduces vertex count.
Creates instanced Static Mesh components from identical components.
Handles complex source meshes, similar to Simplify.

Merge_Settings.Access: Actor > Merge Actors > Merge Actor Settings.

Mesh_Settings.Description: Sets pivot to Level's origin or first selected Actor's pivot.
Combines collision primitives into a single object.
Bakes vertex data into merged mesh.
Control which LODs are added to merged object.
Include imposter LODs from source meshes.

Material_Settings.Description: Sets pixel dimensions for merged Material's textures.
Generates a Normal map for merged Actor.
Generates a Metallic map for merged Actor.
Generates a Roughness map for merged Actor.
Generates a Specular map for merged Actor.
Generates an Emissive map for merged Actor.
Generates an Opacity map for merged Actor.
Generates an Ambient Occlusion map for merged Actor.

Proxy_Settings.Description: Screen size of merged Static Mesh.
Overrides sampling distance for proxy LOD merging.
Sets distance at which meshes are merged.
Angle for hard edges between mesh faces.

Options.Description: Select class for instanced Static Meshes.
Minimum number of instances for instancing.
Do not instance meshes with vertex colors.

Mesh_Generation_Settings.Description: Type of output from mesh approximation.
Expands topology to fill small gaps.

Mesh_Filtering_Settings.Description: Configures mesh clipping with ground plane.
